channel.title: Marxism on The Condition of the Republic
channel.description: Recent content in Marxism on The Condition of the Republic

item.title: Tom Nairn and Ireland
item.description: A note on terminology: Nairn uses the term ‘Protestants’ rather than ‘unionists’ and Ulster rather than ’the six counties’ as ‘Ulster’. In the opening paragraphs of his chapter on Ireland Tom Nairn outlines his understanding of the conflict in the six counties. From his point of view it is a conflict between two communities, both of which are separate from Westminster and Leinster House, neither of whom are invested in it going one way or the other.
